answers.answer: One last thing, family history of epilepsy in Great grandfather, also a variety of others, diabetes, heart disease and high cholesterol (which I have), found in parent and grandparents.

question: I was wondering about something that is happening to me.  Sometimes when I am really tired, and stressed out at the same time, I get this strange thing that happens.  It's been happening for years, the first I can remember where someone pointed it out to me was when I was 17 years old.  It feels as if there is a itching in my sinuses, and a pulling or tension in the muscles around my nose and eyes.  Sometimes I get a headache with it, and it pulls up to the top of my head.  I press on my nose and forehead to relieve the extremely uncomfortable feeling.  It is not painful, just really a very tight feeling that only relieves with pressure to my face. Usually when I put the pressure, my left arm jerks and my hand stiffens into an odd shape, (my husband says it is like a claw shape), sometimes when it jerks it hits my head.  Also when I open my eyes after, I can't see for nearly 8-10 seconds.  Recently during one of these blindness's, my husband said my eyes were facing opposite directions.  I wasn't concerned about what happens until he told me that.  I really thought it was just some sinus problem, or a weird habit when I get tired.  I can only recall a few times that this happened during the day, it usually is at night when I go to bed.  Have you ever heard of such a strange thing?Other medical conditions: pcos, panic / anxiety disorder (following my father's death)
title: Eyes Going Outward
